metadata.title: Week 1 Day 1: Introduction to Latin Alphabet

prior_knowledge_digest: This lesson assumes no prior knowledge of Latin, as it is the first day of instruction. Students will be introduced to the Latin alphabet, its pronunciation, and basic vocabulary. The focus will be on familiarizing students with the sounds and letters of Latin, setting a foundation for future learning. The virtue of discipline will be highlighted as an essential part of language learning, encouraging students to develop consistent study habits.
yesterday_recap: N/A - This is the first day of the course.
misconception_watchlist: Misidentifying Latin letters with similar English counterparts

primary: Students will recognize and pronounce the Latin alphabet.
Students will understand the importance of discipline in language learning.
Students will learn the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
Students will begin to build a basic Latin vocabulary.
Students will connect the virtue of discipline with their study habits.

lesson_flow.description: Welcome students and introduce the day's objectives.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and prepare for the lesson.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Set a positive tone and emphasize the virtue of discipline.

lesson_flow.description: Introduce the Latin alphabet and its pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Listen and repeat the sounds of each letter.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use the alphabet chart and audio recordings to demonstrate.

lesson_flow.description: Lead students in the Alphabet Chant to reinforce pronunciation.
lesson_flow.student_action: Participate in the chant, focusing on correct pronunciation.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Encourage enthusiasm and correct any mispronunciations.

lesson_flow.student_action: Repeat vocabulary words after the teacher.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Use flashcards and focus on clear pronunciation.

lesson_flow.description: Discuss the faith phrase 'In principio' and its significance.
lesson_flow.student_action: Reflect on the phrase and its meaning.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Connect the phrase to the virtue of discipline.

lesson_flow.description: Review the day's learning and preview the next lesson.
lesson_flow.student_action: Ask questions and prepare for the next class.
lesson_flow.teacher_notes: Reiterate the importance of discipline in learning.
